page.title: 02ELECTRIC TRAINS
page.content: Work started on the electrification of the Bedford-St Pancras-Moorgate line in early 1979. By January 1982 the electric service operated to Moorgate, and by May to St Pancras. The{Midland Suburban Electrification {Scheme}not only makes commuting quicker but has modernised the route by replacing dated equipment, as the old track layout dated from the days of steam traction. The modernisation has increased the top speed to over 100 mph and has reduced the journey time by 15 minutes. A new interchange at King's Cross brings London closer, so Bedford is now more attractive to commuters. This has resulted in an increase in property value in the surrounding area with old houses modernised and converted to flats.
